info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 01 at 3:02PM CDT until July 01 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Perry County in south central Illinois... Southern Jefferson County in south central Illinois... Northwestern Franklin County in south central Illinois... * Until 345 PM CDT. * At 301 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Tamaroa, or near Du Quoin, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon, Du Quoin, Pinckneyville, Rend Lake Area, Woodlawn, Tamaroa, Waltonville, Nason and St. Johns. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 88 and 98. Interstate 64 in Illinois between Mile Markers 63 and 83. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
